alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough; Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 4:06PM EDT until June 09 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Hillsborough County in southern New Hampshire... Southwestern Rockingham County in southern New Hampshire... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 406 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Derry, Salem, Pelham, Londonderry and Windham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 10. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
